trans-unit.source: How to create a cloud collection of Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: How to create a cloud collection of Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a deployment of Azure RemoteApp that saves data in the Azure cloud.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a deployment of Azure RemoteApp that saves data in the Azure cloud.

trans-unit.source: There are two kinds of Azure RemoteApp collections:
trans-unit.target: There are two kinds of Azure RemoteApp collections:

trans-unit.source: Cloud: resides completely in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Cloud: resides completely in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to save all data in the cloud (so a cloud-only collection) or to connect your collection to a VNET and save data there.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to save all data in the cloud (so a cloud-only collection) or to connect your collection to a VNET and save data there.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid: includes a virtual network for on-premises access - this requires the use of Azure AD and an on-premises Active Directory environment.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid: includes a virtual network for on-premises access - this requires the use of Azure AD and an on-premises Active Directory environment.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the process of creating a cloud collection.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the process of creating a cloud collection.

trans-unit.source: There are four steps:
trans-unit.target: There are four steps:

trans-unit.source: Create a RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: Create a RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: Optionally configure directory synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Optionally configure directory synchronization.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure AD + Active Directory, you have to to synchronize users, contacts, and passwords from your on-premises Active Directory to your Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure AD + Active Directory, you have to to synchronize users, contacts, and passwords from your on-premises Active Directory to your Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: Publish RemoteApp apps.
trans-unit.target: Publish RemoteApp apps.

trans-unit.source: Configure user access.
trans-unit.target: Configure user access.

trans-unit.source: Note *This topic is in the middle of being reworked.
trans-unit.target: Note *This topic is in the middle of being reworked.

trans-unit.source: I've updated the steps to reflect the new UI, but I'm not yet able to republish the entire topic.
trans-unit.target: I've updated the steps to reflect the new UI, but I'm not yet able to republish the entire topic.

trans-unit.source: I'm working on a couple of new articles that will make it much easier to figure out your authentication and collection options.
trans-unit.target: I'm working on a couple of new articles that will make it much easier to figure out your authentication and collection options.

trans-unit.source: So, if you're confused, please know that I know and am working as quickly as I can to get better info to you.
trans-unit.target: So, if you're confused, please know that I know and am working as quickly as I can to get better info to you.

trans-unit.source: Thanks.*
trans-unit.target: Thanks.*

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: You need to do the following before creating the collection:
trans-unit.target: You need to do the following before creating the collection:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign up</linkText><title></title> for Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign up</linkText><title></title> for Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Gather information about the users that you want to grant access to.
trans-unit.target: Gather information about the users that you want to grant access to.

trans-unit.source: This can be either Microsoft account information or Active Directory work account information for users.
trans-unit.target: This can be either Microsoft account information or Active Directory work account information for users.

trans-unit.source: This procedure assumes you are either going to use one of the template images provided as part of your subscription or that you have already uploaded the template image you want to use.
trans-unit.target: This procedure assumes you are either going to use one of the template images provided as part of your subscription or that you have already uploaded the template image you want to use.

trans-unit.source: If you need to upload a different template image, you can do that from the Template Images page.
trans-unit.target: If you need to upload a different template image, you can do that from the Template Images page.

trans-unit.source: Just click upload a template image and follow the steps in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Just click upload a template image and follow the steps in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Want to use the Office 365 ProPlus image?
trans-unit.target: Want to use the Office 365 ProPlus image?

trans-unit.source: Check out info <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Check out info <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Want to provide custom apps or LOB programs?
trans-unit.target: Want to provide custom apps or LOB programs?

trans-unit.source: Create a new <linkText>image</linkText><title></title> and use it in your cloud collection.
trans-unit.target: Create a new <linkText>image</linkText><title></title> and use it in your cloud collection.

trans-unit.source: Figure out whether you need to connect to a VNET.
trans-unit.target: Figure out whether you need to connect to a VNET.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to connect to a VNET, make sure it meets the sizing guidelines and that it can connect to RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to connect to a VNET, make sure it meets the sizing guidelines and that it can connect to RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: If you're using a VNET, decide whether you want to join it to your local Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: If you're using a VNET, decide whether you want to join it to your local Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create a cloud-only collection:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create a cloud-only collection:

trans-unit.source: In the management portal, go to the RemoteApp page.
trans-unit.target: In the management portal, go to the RemoteApp page.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for your collection, and select your region.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for your collection, and select your region.

trans-unit.source: Choose the plan that you want to use - standard or basic.
trans-unit.target: Choose the plan that you want to use - standard or basic.

trans-unit.source: Choose the template to use for this collection.
trans-unit.target: Choose the template to use for this collection.

trans-unit.source: Tip: Your subscription for RemoteApp comes with template images that contain Office 365 or Office 2013 (for trial use) programs, some published (such as Word) and others ready to publish.
trans-unit.target: Tip: Your subscription for RemoteApp comes with template images that contain Office 365 or Office 2013 (for trial use) programs, some published (such as Word) and others ready to publish.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a new <linkText>image</linkText><title></title> and use it in your cloud collection.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a new <linkText>image</linkText><title></title> and use it in your cloud collection.

trans-unit.source: Click Create RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: Click Create RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: Important: It can take up to 30 minutes to provision your collection.
trans-unit.target: Important: It can take up to 30 minutes to provision your collection.

trans-unit.source: After your RemoteApp collection has been created, double-click the name of the collection.
trans-unit.target: After your RemoteApp collection has been created, double-click the name of the collection.

trans-unit.source: That will bring up the Quick Start page - this is where you finish configuring the collection.
trans-unit.target: That will bring up the Quick Start page - this is where you finish configuring the collection.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create a cloud + VNET collection:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create a cloud + VNET collection:

trans-unit.source: In the management portal, go to the RemoteApp page.
trans-unit.target: In the management portal, go to the RemoteApp page.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Create with VNET.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Create with VNET.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for your collection.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for your collection.

trans-unit.source: Choose the plan that you want to use - standard or basic.
trans-unit.target: Choose the plan that you want to use - standard or basic.

trans-unit.source: Choose the VNET you already created.
trans-unit.target: Choose the VNET you already created.

trans-unit.source: Don't know how to do that?
trans-unit.target: Don't know how to do that?

trans-unit.source: For now, the steps are in the <linkText>hybrid</linkText><title></title> topic.
trans-unit.target: For now, the steps are in the <linkText>hybrid</linkText><title></title> topic.

trans-unit.source: Decide whether you want to join your collection to your domain.
trans-unit.target: Decide whether you want to join your collection to your domain.

trans-unit.source: If yes, you'll need to use AD Connect to integrate Azure AD and your Active Directory environment.
trans-unit.target: If yes, you'll need to use AD Connect to integrate Azure AD and your Active Directory environment.

trans-unit.source: That's covered in below in Step 2.
trans-unit.target: That's covered in below in Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Click Create RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: Click Create RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use Active Directory, RemoteApp requires directory synchronization between Azure Active Directory and your on-premises Active Directory to synchronize users, contacts, and passwords to your Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use Active Directory, RemoteApp requires directory synchronization between Azure Active Directory and your on-premises Active Directory to synchronize users, contacts, and passwords to your Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Configuring Active Directory for Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title> for planning information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Configuring Active Directory for Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title> for planning information.

trans-unit.source: You can also go directly to <linkText>AD Connect</linkText><title></title> for information.
trans-unit.target: You can also go directly to <linkText>AD Connect</linkText><title></title> for information.

trans-unit.source: A RemoteApp app is the app or program that you provide to your users.
trans-unit.target: A RemoteApp app is the app or program that you provide to your users.

trans-unit.source: It is located in the template image you uploaded for the collection.
trans-unit.target: It is located in the template image you uploaded for the collection.

trans-unit.source: When a user accesses a RemoteApp app, the app appears to run in their local environment, but it is really running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: When a user accesses a RemoteApp app, the app appears to run in their local environment, but it is really running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Before your users can access apps, you need to publish them to the end-user feed – a list of available apps that your users access through the Remote Desktop client.
trans-unit.target: Before your users can access apps, you need to publish them to the end-user feed – a list of available apps that your users access through the Remote Desktop client.

trans-unit.source: You can publish multiple apps to your RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: You can publish multiple apps to your RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: From the RemoteApp publishing page, click Publish to add a program.
trans-unit.target: From the RemoteApp publishing page, click Publish to add a program.

trans-unit.source: You can either publish from the Start menu of the template image or by specifying the path on the template image for the app.
trans-unit.target: You can either publish from the Start menu of the template image or by specifying the path on the template image for the app.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to add from the Start menu, choose the app to publish.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to add from the Start menu, choose the app to publish.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to provide the path to the app, provide a name for the app and the path to where it is installed on the template image.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to provide the path to the app, provide a name for the app and the path to where it is installed on the template image.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created your RemoteApp collection, you need to add the users that you want to be able to use your remote resources.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created your RemoteApp collection, you need to add the users that you want to be able to use your remote resources.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Active Directory, the users that you provide access to need to exist in the Active Directory tenant associated with the subscription you used to create this RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Active Directory, the users that you provide access to need to exist in the Active Directory tenant associated with the subscription you used to create this RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: From the Quick Start page, click Configure user access.
trans-unit.target: From the Quick Start page, click Configure user access.

trans-unit.source: Enter the work account (from Active Directory) or Microsoft account that you want to grant access for.
trans-unit.target: Enter the work account (from Active Directory) or Microsoft account that you want to grant access for.

trans-unit.source: Notes:
trans-unit.target: Notes:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you use the “user@domain.com” format.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you use the “user@domain.com” format.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Office 365 ProPlus in your collection, you must use the Active Directory identities for your users.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Office 365 ProPlus in your collection, you must use the Active Directory identities for your users.

trans-unit.source: This helps validate licensing.
trans-unit.target: This helps validate licensing.

trans-unit.source: After the users are validated, click Save.
trans-unit.target: After the users are validated, click Save.

trans-unit.source: That's it - you have successfully created and deployed your RemoteApp cloud collection.
trans-unit.target: That's it - you have successfully created and deployed your RemoteApp cloud collection.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to have your users download and install the Remote Desktop client.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to have your users download and install the Remote Desktop client.

trans-unit.source: You can find the URL for the client on the RemoteApp Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: You can find the URL for the client on the RemoteApp Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Then, have users log into the client and access the apps you published.
trans-unit.target: Then, have users log into the client and access the apps you published.
